title: AeroGPT: Leveraging Large-Scale Audio Model for Aero-Engine Bearing Fault Diagnosis
author: Jiale Liu (University of Electronic Science and Technology of China), Dandan Peng (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Huan Wang (City University of Hong Kong), Chenyu Liu (Northwestern Polytechnical University), Yan-Fu Li (Tsinghua University), Min Xie (City University of Hong Kong), ...
relevance_why: The use of large-scale audio models to interpret vibration signals is relevant to audio processing and could influence methods Haohe is developing for audio-language and audio generation tasks by adapting techniques learned from one domain to enhance another.
background: The paper focuses on diagnosing faults in aerospace engine bearings by leveraging large-scale audio models to transform raw vibration signals into interpretable fault diagnoses.
contribution: AeroGPT introduces a framework that integrates large-scale audio models with vibration signal analysis to directly provide fault diagnoses, achieving accuracy rates of 98.94% and 100% on two aerospace datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied primarily on deep learning techniques which output raw logits or confidence scores that require additional post-processing.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uses generative fault classification to directly produce natural language fault diagnoses, eliminating the need for intermediate processing of outputs.

key_innovation: The direct integration of generative capabilities from large audio models allows for interactive, interpretable diagnostics that support follow-up analysis.
real_world_impact: This framework could significantly improve maintenance protocols in aerospace industries by providing immediate, actionable insights into engine conditions, thereby enhancing safety and reducing downtime.
limitations: The paper does not discuss limitations explicitly, focusing more on results and contributions.

new_terms.Vibration Signal Alignment (VSA): **Vibration Signal Alignment** adapts general audio knowledge to the unique vibration characteristics of aero-engine bearings for enhanced fault diagnosis.
new_terms.Generative Fault Classification (GFC): **Generative Fault Classification** leverages large language model capabilities to generate human-readable fault diagnoses instead of numerical classifications.
